intro: Hieracium prodanianum subsp. prodanianum, commonly known as the Greater Spear-thistle, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. The plant has dark green, spiny leaves that are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, blooming from late spring to early summer. It is part of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust root system.
